description.en: The KIMEDS Ontology defines various notions related to risk management for medical devices.

abstract.value: The KIMEDS Ontology defines various notions related to risk management for medical devices. It builds on terms from ISO 14971. The central notion of the KIMEDS ontology is that of a Safe Design Argument (SDA), a reusable artifact that aims to demonstrate how a specific hazard occurring with a device has been mitigated (possibly using further context information and assumptions).

comment.undefined: A credible reference (or list of such) to the state of the art of achieving safety with respect to a certain class of hazards, e.g. referring to an international norm such as ISO 60601.
An incidence or occurrence leading to another event and/or (eventually) a hazardous situation.
A (physical or logical) part of a device.
A matrix with axes representing severity and probability without defining which combinations of those are acceptable. Contains upper bounds of the axes (with the lower bounds being equal to 0).
Information about possible environments the device can be used in that may affect probability or severity of some risk.
Potential source of harm
Circumstance in which people, property or the environment is/are exposed to one or more hazards.
A tuple containing the combination of severity, probability and information whether such combination is acceptable or not.
A safe design argument (SDA), where the purpose is to make a safety assurance
A safe design argument (SDA), where the purpose is to make a safety assurance
Injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment.
A concrete piece of objective evidence (or a reference to such) that an SDA has been implemented, e.g. reference to a line of code or a particular section in the device manual.
Structured artifact specifying a concrete implementation or realization of a specific Risk SDA.
Reusable artifact embodying or expressing one possible method or approach to risk control.
Defines acceptable and unacceptable combinations of probability and severity of a given risk matrix.
Hazard associated with a specific hazardous situation, function and a specific device component.
Combination of harm and its associated probability and severity.
A specific functionality of a device related with the device specific hazard.
SDA where the purpose is to mitigate a managed risk.
The original, mitigated risk with lowered value(s) of probability and/or severity.
A boolean value denoting the level acceptance
The maximal value representing the most severe risks.
Probability of a hazardous situation leading to harm
Probability of a hazardous situation occurring
Name of an instance
Unique identifier

Measure of the possible consequences of a hazard. An integer representing severity in a scale from 1 to MAX (MAX being defined by one of the RiskTable dimensions), with 1 as the least severe and MAX as the most.
The maximal value representing the most probable risks.

Probability of occurrence of harm, expressed as an integer from 1 to MAX (MAX being defined by one of the RiskTable dimensions), with 1 as the least probable and MAX as the most. The probability of occurrence of harm (P) can additionally be expressed as a combination of separate probabilities (P = P1*P2). A decomposition into P1 and P2 is not mandatory.
